caption: Went there for my anniversary and had an awful experience.  We were denied a food menu for a half hour and, after ordering cocktails, were repeatedly pressured to order a bottle of wine - on five occasions in a half hour.  At one point, we had to literally stop the waiter from opening a bottle of wine of his choosing despite repeated refusals.  This is predatory and harassing - the waiter was arguing with us about our selections and attempting to order pricier options for us.  We were told that the main course was not enough and that we would need additional courses. We were given appetizers that we did not order, including a bottle of wine that we did not order as well.  This added $200 to our bill.  When I addressed this with the owner, he threatened to call the cops and told me to get a lawyer.  This is completely rude and unprofessional and does not reflect care about our experience or concerns.  Very unfortunate experience - it seems that the only objective is to extract as much money from the patron as possible.  Just very disappointed that an establishment like this is allowed to operate in this way, we were so uncomfortable and felt victimized - please go elsewhere and please support a different small business owner.  Also, by the way, the food was mediocre and lacking flavor.  Lobster was overcooked and chewy.  Bad all around.
Food is excellent but very pricey and wine was charged at higher rate then promised....
The service was great however the food was below average.
Dinner for 2 including tip was ~$600. For that price, expected a lot more in regards to the food . The only thing that met expectations was the service.
The staff and meal were amazing. Staff were super attentive and helpful. The meal was so amazing and then the dessert was even better. Thank you for a wonderful evening.
Pelago is the finest restaurant in Chicago. Breathtaking Italian cuisine. Homemade pasta is unbeatable amd the service is impeccable and second to none. Thank you Pelago. We will be back.
Quaint and charming space.  Attentive service. Food was well portioned and spot on.  Will make it a regular stop when in Chicago. Highly recommend.

My favorite restaurant in Chicago! It is a hidden gem. We have been coming here for the past few years for a lot of special events such as birthdays, anniversaries, etc. Everytime we come here it’s truly a memorable night. The staff is so great. The restaurant is very clean and beautiful. The food is out of this world. We love Pelago for its 5-star service every single time we go here. Highly recommend!!

The best Italian restaurant in Chicago. The food is exquisite and the service is top notch. It is always a pleasure to dine at Pelago because anything you order from the menu is cooked to perfection and everyone is so nice and attentive.
Good food but pretty overpriced.  If you want a fancy experience this is the place to go because they literally walk you everywhere and open every single door for you😂

If you want authentic Italian food at a price that won't crush your budget, there are several good restaurants in Elmwood Park. Don't waste your money on the same dishes you could get elsewhere for a fraction of the cost and enough to take home for another meal!
Great food and best service as always.

Entrees were good,  but the problem we had was unfair pricing and padding of the bill. Double charges for drinks that were not ordered, a pasta tasting was brought to the table with no indication of price on menu or verbally. Thought it was a promo and ended up being $60 per person.  Supposed promo appetizers totaled $480 for our table of 8.  A Black Martini was ordered which should not come with olives but did. When the waiter was told he took his fingers and removed the olives.  Really?  A replacement drink was ordered and subsequently we were charged for both. Many of the staff were very nice but when we addressed the issues with the waiter he said that's the way it is. When leaving the restaurant the owner basically ignored our concerns and said he would simply reply to this comment. "People in Italy would be offended if they were informed of pricing" was his comment. Extremely disappointed. Buyer beware and double-check your bill! See attached

(Translated by Google) Delicious food, very careful the taste of the dishes, very friendly in attention.  (Original) Deliciosa la comida,  muy cuidado el sabor de los platos,  muy amables en la atención.
Exquisite!
Nice
The rabbit highly recommended!

We recently had a change of plans when the hotel restaurant we had booked ended up with such loud music that we could not have a conversation. Thankfully the concierge steered us toward Pelago. I have some food challenges, (gluten free, lactose free) and this chef was a genius. He made a GF pasta with truffles that melted in our mouths! The entrees were beautifully prepared as well, and we were even graced with a GF anniversary treat to top it all off. Service was friendly and gracious. We'll be back!
Perfect risotto
High end yet small, quiet and intimate. Delicious Italian fare. I had a lovely fish soup and sausage, peas, stuffed pasta in a delicious sauce. Cordial prompt service with a smile. Recommend highly
Outstanding across the board.
The food is great and the service is wonderful

A wonderful restaurant with amazing food. Great quiet, intimate atmosphere and the wait staff is extremely attentive. But be prepared to spend the Benjamins because it's highly overpriced, even the water. Unfortunately the $$ that is reflected on Google should be $$$$.
The foods the friendly environment and services

Food was excellent but pricey, not worth it. The sommelier/manager was very rude. Brought us an appetizer and then argued with us that we ordered it (we hadn't) and refused to take it back. Put a damper on our night, would definitely recommend going ANYwhere else in Chicago!
Great food with service to match.

At best, the food is sub par. The presentation does not make up for its lack of quality. The entire staff needs remedial classes in etiquette. I was supposed to meet two friends here for dinner. I arrived at approximately 845pm dressed in a suit and tie. The Pelago staff stopped me at the door and questioned me on what I was doing there. I told them that I was there to meet friends for dinner. The staff talked among themselves in Italian and they said they did not think a person like me would have friends eating there. Much to their surprise, I happen to speak Italian fluently. I responded in Italian and informed them that I was sure that my friends were inside. I called my friends on my cellphone and they came out and retrieved me. As I said, they need remedial training in etiquette.
Delicious food

Refused service 45 minutes before closing time with only a party of 3, even though we were guests of the hotel. They weren't busy but the man in the chefs uniform at the bar looked us up and down and then looked back at the hostess and just said "no". Won't be returning to the hotel or restaurant any time in the foreseeable future.

Disappointed.   Cold and salty food and I couldn't wait to get out of there.  Risotto was very tasty but the waiter wouldn't leave us alone.  I paid for the risotto and 2 ice teas $72 bucks. Never again
One of the 5 best meals I've ever enjoyed.

Just had a dinner at this place.  Dined at this restaurant many time. Good food,  usually good service,  over priced, but great location to eat outside. Usually valet parking is $13.00. Got our car today and were charged $35.00. On our question why this is so expensive we're told that the restaurant doesn't know and have nothing to do with valet.  Chef came out and with the words "if you don't like it,  don't come back" throw some money thought our car window. Obviously, they don't care about customer,  customer service or people coming back. Ruined evening by the place owner. Needless to say, never come back to this place.
Loved the service, freshly baked bread and some of the best lasagna!
Perfection
Truly an experience. Simple yet sophisticated atmosphere. Food is impeccable. Service spot on for the price point.
Best house made pasta in Chicago. Great service
Delicious food! Nice staff 😊

(Translated by Google) Very good restaurant, everything is perfect: the welcome, the decoration, the service and the food served. A simple map, but well studied. A wine list, very interesting and very diverse from Italy mainly. The gnocchi are perfect. The right risotto, the well cooked fish and the perfect cutlet. A good address from the opinion of French connoisseurs.  (Original) Très bon restaurant, tout est parfait: l’accueil, la décoration, le service ainsi que les mets servis. Un carte simple, mais bien étudiée. Un carte des vins, très intéressante et très diversifiée en provenance de l’Italie principalement. Les gnocchis sont parfait. Le risotto comme il faut, le poisson bien cuit et l’escalope parfaite. Une bonne adresse de l’avis de connaisseurs français.
Great gnocchi
Excellent diner and wines. (Too) Big portions ;-) must do.
(Translated by Google) very good, excellent food  (Original) muito bom , excelente comida

We enjoyed a nice dinner at Pelago. Overall the food was a 3.5-4 out of 5. We had a few dishes: the burrata (which was our favourite), the fettuccine with truffles (when I had this dish last time here about a year ago it was much better. This time it felt like the pasta was just slightly overcooked and not as good as previous), the pompano fish (it was good) and the lamb special (this was okay). Service is always great here though and the ambiance is nice.  Not sure if I would come back again though
Best Italian food I have ever ate! Definitely reccomend! Chef Mauro is amazing! 🤗 ..My favorite part was dessert

We're surprised to see some negative reviews here: I think most were towards the wait staff and the pricing. For us, the wait staff were very pleasant (the female hostesses were not the nicest, however our actual waiter was great). The best pasta dish by far was the truffle fettucine which is not on the menu; it is amazing. Regarding the pricing: this is always subjective. For three of us dining the bill came to $977 before tip so there you go. That's the benchmark and you can decide if you want to dine here. We chose some great wines so most likely the bill could be smaller for most people dining here with three guests

Beyond marvelous: amazing food, service at the highest level,, intimate room... I will return often.  One of the finest dining experiences in Chicago Expensive and worth it. Run, do not walk right over. Trust me!
Had reserved a table but never got in.
(Translated by Google) Nothing special  (Original) Nada del otro mundo
Really liked the food for a decent price. Thanks.
Great small restaurant, all pastas made on site, excellent service, diverse winner list and menu...a winner
Food is good and friendly people
Great food good service
Very good and classic
Good
For a European, far from Italian standards concerning  food. Despite  of that,  good staff. Wines age vert extensive  regardless  of quality
Great place to go
Good food

I stay consistently at the Raffaello and have ordered room service a couple of times from Pelago. Good food but overpriced.  Forgot a Christmas gift and gloves at the lobby ATM. Hotel staff accidentally gave it to Pelago. I was so distraught that I lost the gift that the chef mistook it for anger at his staff and he started berating me. So rude for no reason.
It was absolutely great
Great food and nice setting
Sooooo good
Great food, great view and lots of chooces
Great service
Nice fish restaurant, very busy and best to book

My wife and I absolutely love the food AND the staff at Pelago. The restaurant is very intimate, cozy, and comfortable and the food is fantastic. I love fish and the preparations are delightful. My wife prefers meat and is never disappointed. We highly recommend Pelago, a gem in the heart of Chicago.
Yummy 😋
Good food and aood atmosphere. We waited about 30 minutes for a table but considering it was a Saturday it wasn't too bad.
Ok
So good for an Italian food.
Good Italian seafood restaurant
Amazing food and badass service
(Translated by Google) The best of the best  (Original) Lo mejor de lo mejor
(Translated by Google) Good food quality price  (Original) Bon menjar qualitat preu

This is literally my favorite restaurant in Chicago. The chef creates a new recipe items based on your preference and it is always fresh and so tasteful , the service experience is world-class, and Alfredo always helps us feel like we are at home not at a restaurant.
(Translated by Google) Great staff, very good dishes, excellent products  (Original) Ottimo personale, piatti molto buoni, ottimi prodotti
Quite possibly best Italian cooking Chicago by Chef Mauro.
Great food. Service was spot on and everything was delicious. Can be a little pricey but it's a sit down restaurant in Chicago.
Great
We very much enjoyed our meal here. The food was tasty and staff was courteous. We would definitely visit again.   Worth a visit.

Overcrowded. Very noisy. Overpriced. Very uneven brusque service. Food OK but underwhelming. I have eaten in true 5 star restaurants all over the world and don't understand why restaurants like this get 4 and 5 star reviews. Look elsewhere.
Foods amazing, not all of the staff understands the consumer demo, can be disconnected. Dont be afraid to set the tone for your enjoyment let the food speak to you bc its amazing!
one if my favorite restaurants in Chicago
Good products, good range. Most items are expensive

Food was fantastic but over priced.. small Dover sole 55.  Crown and diet Coke 18 each.  A plate of broccoli robhi  22.  Insane prices. Squid stuffed with veggies 22. All said and done 160.00 for this meal. Again food was fantastic in taste but well over priced for the value.
Okay

This is a very fine restaurant. From the time you enter the door, you will get the message that  the service is going to be impeccable and that you are in for an incredible dining experience. The food is creative, delicious and excitingly presented. The wine list was extensive and the sommelier was extremely helpful. An extremely attentive waitstaff accomodated each person's (6 in our party) every need. Pelago compares well or exceeds almost  anyone's expectation of a 4-5 star dining extperience. But, it is, in fact, that; a high end dining experience and those are typically priced accordingly. The $$ rating is misleading.  Prepare your party to enjoy a meal that is an event. We had just rolled in from a 6 hour road trip and were staying at the Raffaello. We may not have been in the right frame of mind to fully enjoy this fantastic offering.  You need to be prepared to "dine" as you are not simply going out to "eat." Be prepared to take advantage of, and fully enjoy, this rare culinary experience!
Goodd
Simply amazing.
Delectible authenticity.  Fantastic wine list.
It is a very wonderful place to be all around warm I was very relaxed when I was there
The experience I had for each apetaizer was spectacular, I loved them all but the most explosive was that of different SPAGHETTI! Come and enjoy an exquisite plate of food!

An overpriced dissapointment.  We  visited Pelago a couple of years ago with a friend for a wonderful meal on the patio.  My husband had been suggesting that we return ever since. We made a mistake. Let's start with the insanely priced winelist.  It was hard to find fairly priced bottle and most of the offerings were $100+ going all the way up to over $1000. And while the winelist offered some intresting wines from interesting and unusual Italian regions, the wines by the glass were perfunctory, boring (Frescobaldi Pinot Grigio anyone? *Yawn*) and $16-17 per glass from a bottle bottle that sells for $14.95 at any liquor store. The menu was not seasonal at all which is my greatest dining greivance. Pelago's heavy meats, sauces and pastas would have been better served in the winter. Sadly items that must not rotate off the menu. The chef must be very lazy. There was a lone chopped tomato and mozzarella salad but the heirloom tomatoes were bland and flavorless; they were the grocery store variety not the farmer's market variety. What a pity this being August.  Another pasta dish was a sticky mess. What was touted at "fresh tomatoes and eggplant" really was pasta drowning in overcooked tomato sauce with bitter eggplant and stringy mozzarella cubes thrown in to create a big glob. In short nothing tasted of summer. Nothing really tasted great. Final verdict: two people, two salads, two pastas, two glasses of mediocre wine. $150. Never again.

We were the guests of another party. There was no seating available, and they have an extensive winner list. Good here is delicious and cooked the way you request it. Process however are astronomical, $18 for chocolate pudding but for me the company made my evening.

One of the finest restaurants in the area and possibly the city, your experience will be enjoyed. They have a nice sidewalk seating area, which I recommend when the weather is nice, and a stunning interior that makes wonderful use of the available space. It can be a bit loud inside, especially if there is a larger party in the dining area.  The pastas are made in-house and you can tell the difference. Perfectly cooked al dente pasta dishes paired with a very healthy wine list (it isn't that healthy to your wallet though, not that I would expect a "bargain" in a place like this).  if you are looking for a truly high end dining experience, but one that's a bit removed from some of the hectic tourist traffic on Michigan or bustling crowds on Randolph, you should come here.
Buonissimo!!! Authentic doesn't describe the flavors chef brings to his dishes. Elegant setting on the patio or inside. Small and exclusive. No riff raff.  A neighborhood favorite on the Gold Coast.
Excellent experience
One of the best places to eat around Michigan Av. Must try two things - stuffed lamb chops and full grilled fish. Simply amazing good and very courteous staff
Ciao best Italian restaurant in Chicago
Very disappointing meal. I even returned my main course for the first time in my life. On the other hand it is quite exoensive.
Excellent food and service. Really enjoyed the pasta sampler.
Michelin grade experience.

A true 5 star Italian dining experience. The food and service were both excellent and the deserts and cheeses were equally tasty. A slightly more formal setting with nice small touches like a small chair for the ladies handbags. Would recommend it for a special occasion.
Wonderful..elegant..slow and sophisticated.
Very good fine food in a pleasant venue with excellent service. Be prepared to pay appropriately for what you get.
Absolutely delicious, 100% authentic Italian!!

Very misleading waiter, when asked for a specific bottle of wine, the waiter tried to suggest that it was unavailable and then said he would bring out a comparative wine that we would like. When I questioned the price it was over three times the amount of our original bottle ($450!) When I confirmed this was not ok, he then said he would get my original bottle requested. Disgusting behaviour at a high end restaurant, we were a group of six spending a lot of money, this is just pure customer abuse, I will never be returning to this restaurant.

A truly outstanding meal from antipasto through to dessert. The pasta sampler was a real treat which gave us each the chance to try four of Pelago's delicious fresh pastas. The hen and sage ragu was the favorite but all were superb.
What a lovely experience!! Thank you to a staff and chef who gave us a relaxed and luxurious European evening.
The food was absolutely delicious!!! Wonderful atmosphere and waiters/waitresses
Excellent service and really great tasting food.
Love Pelago, great for romantic quiet dinner. Chef is in the kitchen actually working unlike other places. Food is amazing!!! I highly recommend this restaurant.
Amazing food.  And even better service.  Absolutely exceeded our expectations.

I walked in a few minutes before 10 for a drink. A dirty, obese man dressed as a chef splayed out over two bar stools informed me that the bar was only for customers dining in the restaurant.  Perplexed, I asked for clarification; the maitre'd asked if I wanted to eat, motioning with his hand to his mouth. I declined and was shown the door.  I've eaten here before; the food was good but overpriced.  The place was sparsely populated, perhaps due to a lack of empathy for their declining customer base.

Absolutely one of the best meals I've ever had. If it's your first time visiting, splurge and go for the chef's tasting and you'll get to try SO many different things. There are five courses: cheese, risotto, pasta, choice of meat or fish, and dessert. Each course comes with a sampling of 3-4 items! Everything was out of this world and the wait staff was amazing. They were attentive, warm and knowledgeable. I really felt transported to Italy!
Excellent food, unique upscale atmosphere, and very attentive/hospitable staff! The saffron risotto is to die for!

We had a wonderful meal here on a Thurs evening to celebrate our Anniversary. From the moment we walked in to the moment we left, we were treated so well. The employees seemed to really like being there and wanted to show us a good time (which they did.) Our waiter was very friendly and happy to give suggestions when my husband was trying to narrow down his dinner choice. We had some nice cocktails while waiting for dinner as well as a salad that we shared. The meal was delicious! My husband had lamb and I had the gnocchi. Sure, the place is pricy, but the atmosphere and service (not to mention the spectacular food) is worth the price. This is not some place I would go all the time because of the price, but I would go for special occasions or maybe just for a nice date night.  I would recommend Pelago Ristorante for sure!
Okay let's order everything on the menu while half of Chicago walks by gawking and horrified.....
We have dined all over chicago and it's some of the worst customer service I've seen.  Too many great food Italian places in chicago to ever go back.

Sorry to say this is my last trip to this restaurant we arrived at 2:15 and left at 3:30 could not finish my overpriced wine in a fine dining restaurant  the owner turned off the lights very rude the hostess agreed after getting home and calling the restaurant I have spent $$$$ in this establishment. He wanted us to leave. No problem will never be back or refer this place to anyone.

This upscale Italian gem will delight locals and  natives alike. We had been to Pelago a few times before, but only for lunch. Last night my wife and I decided to splurge a bit for Valentine's Day, and we were rewarded with a sophisticated, yet daring 5-course performance by chef Mauro Mafrici.  The theme of the evening being Valentine, each course incorporated the color red. We started with a tomato and seafood soup, wonderfully supple yet flavorful. Next came cappelletti in a bacon sauce; if you ever wondered about the canonical definition of "al dente," this was it. The following dish, risotto with nduja sausage dressing, highlighted chef Mafrici's creative reinterpretation of Italian culinary tradition: risotto is very much a northern dish, whereas nduja comes from Calabria. I substituted branzuni for the default beef dish, though both proved delicious. The grand finale was rose petal panna cotta, featuring, yes, edible petals.  If you are looking for a classy excursion into the finest Italian cuisine, Pelago is the go-to place.

The service was rude and uptight, the only good was the hosted, the waiter extremely aregent and short of patients, same with the rest of the stars, the food and drink over priced for what you get, and after we got sick from their food they totally egnord us STAY AWAY THERE ARE BETTER PLACED AT THIS LEVEL ALL OVER CHICAGO

I had two carne Asada tacos, they were really well portioned. A lot of meat on them. Flavor was pretty good.  The salsas are pretty authentic. No guacamole tho. That seems to be a norm up here. I'm from Southern California. They're not as good as Mexico or Southern California (border area) but they're the best I've had in this area.  Way better than that parrot place.  Only drawback is their price.. Three bucks for a taco is a bit much.
A wee bit stuffy and overpriced!
Excellent food and exceptional service, would have given five stars but ....overpriced.
Lovely outdoor seating, romantic atmosphere, great food and award winning service. Totally enjoyed Pelago dining.
Pelago has great Italian food and a good atmosphere. The menu doesn't change that often, but all of the dishes are great.
The ultimate Italian dining experience. Fresh Pastas and a wide variety of fish, salads, soups, etc. Best Italian restaurant I've been too.
Pasta is always cooked perfectly. The dishes are wonderfully prepared and the service is exceptional.
Delicious pasta, great service
Food was absolutely wonderful,  and the service was outstanding!
Service is great. Food is great... a bit pricy.
Dont go, unless you want to pay high prices for a tasteless food.  Service was worst than the food  Chicago has hundreds of options  Dont waste your time at this place  Please dont go !

food was great but watch out with the wines, they served us a much more expensive  one from the same vineyard than the one ordered, thank goodness i remember the number. They settled for one free bottle, but still turned out to be more than expected. i just dont like the pressure to order more food and drinks that we all felt

Our visit to Pelago was spectacular.  The service we received from the entire staff was remarkable.  The recommendations we received from our server, Brian, for both food and wine were delicious.  We've enjoyed pasta at fine Italian restaurants, yet we think Pelago's homemade pasta is the best.  The rabbit and scallop/shrimp dishes are also delicious.  If you're in Chicago and seek a romantic dining experience in a beautiful restaurant that offers spectacular food and wine, you must make reservations at Pelago.

Best Italian restaurant I've been to in a long time.  Incredible pasta and the chef takes all kind of special requests.  Very nice dining room, quite intimate without feeling small.  Service is attentive without being suffocating.  A hidden gem.

Based on previous reviews, I'm giving Pelago an "very good" for their food and décor scores.  The poor score for service ONLY relates to the fact that I came into town for business, was exhausted, and attempted to order a meal over the phone for take-out.  However, Pelago apparently doesn't "do" take-out.  Seems strange that I would try to give them a fistful of cash for a meal and they would turn it down based on the principle that you can only enjoy their food in the restaurant.  Reconsider your pretentious policy, Pelago.  You're leaving cash on the table and allowing other restaurants in the area to capitalize on your mistake.  I'm sure I can find somewhere else nearby to take my money....and now I'm happy to do so.
excellent sea bream, with eggplant tart. the fetticine with veal ragu was devine. wonderful old world service with with friendly staff. pricey, but worth it.
We had a wonderful experience!  The food was amazing as well as the service.  The atomosphere was beautiful and relaxed and our waiter took amazing care of us.
I highly recommend this restaurant. the service was unbelievably good and the food delicious.
The food and the service at Pelago is excellent.  I love the truffle pasta.

My palette has been ruined...I will never be able to eat Italian at another restaurant!  The Salmon was divine, the beautiful textural differences from the slightly crisped top to the moist center that practically melted in my mouth! The homemade tiramisu is a must have, I have never had something so perfectly creamy, balanced with a delicate hint of espresso, and a very artistic presentation. The service was great, they are on top of your signals, picking up the plates, offering assistance, and refilling drinks, yet you never feel as though they are hovering over you. Thank you for a fantastic experience!

A great restaurant for lunch or dinner. Fresh pasta and excellent roasted chicken. We loved the decor of the restaurant and the service was top notch for a 5 star rated restaurant. The Chef is also Top Notch and a very nice wine list with excellent Italian wines.

A lot of love and passion go into each dish at this Italian Restaurant.. Some Chef's are good but Chef Mauro is off the chart. Our Risotto rocked and my Roasted Chicken has no equal. Pelago is my favorite restaurant and after one bite you will know why.

I ventured to Pelago Ristorante over the Holidays and I was very impressed. My lunch was a wonderful Carnaroli Risotto with mixed herbs and I can honestly say it is the best Risotto I have ever had. My 2nd plate was an exceptional Roasted Filet of Cod with Potato, Back Olives and Cherry Tomato. The Cod Filet was seasoned perfectly and was very fresh. The attention to detail in each plates presentation and the passion that is put into to each dish was above and beyond any restaurant in Chicago. 5 Stars are not high enough.
Great service and amazing food.  The Chef came out to speak to a number of us to make sure everything was going well.

pelago is superb.  the room is small and comfortable, very tastefully decorated.  service was friendly with a few cheerful missteps.   a four course chef's  choice tasting menu was $54.  the caprese soup was fantastic!  pasta was perfectly cooked and delicious.  beef was gorgeous. the stand-out was the duck wrapped in pork.  deserts were great--the chocolate was stunning.  prices very fair for the quality.  go go go!
